185061-d-04-08-04-DH.Maintenance Railroad Name: READING BLUE MOUNTAIN & NORTHERN RAILROAD COMMISSION
185061-d-04-08-04-DH.Primary Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Transverse/compound fissure   [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Prev.Guides]
185061-d-04-08-04-DH.Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Transverse/compound fissure   [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Prev.Guides]
185061-d-04-08-04-DH.Narrative: EASTBOUND FREIGHT TRAIN 166-07 OPERATING OVER READING AND NORTHERN RAILROAD NO. 1 MAIN DERAILED THREE LOADS OF CONTAINERS.  TRAIN WAS PULLING UPGRADE WHEN IT BEGAN TO SLOW.  ENGINEER BEGAN REDUCING THROTTLE AND AS TRAIN STOPPED, TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK TO INSPECT TRAIN ANDFOUND THE 48TH, 49TH, 50TH CARS DERAILED.  DTTX 741329 WITH SEVEN CONTAINERS (DOUBLE STACKS) DERAILED AND LEANING; CP 520977 WITH THREE CONTAINERS - TWO CONTAINERS ON THEIR SIDES AND ONE UPSIDE DOWN;CP 522227 WITH ONE CONTAINER THAT REMAINED ON THE CAR.  METHOD OF OPERATION SHOWN AS "OTHER" - DCS RULES.  DCS TERRITORY (AUTHORIZED BY FORM D).  TRAIN 166-07 CUT AWAY FROM THE DERAILED CARS AND RAN TO ALLENTOWN WITH THE HEADEND 47 CARS. 166 WAS ON THE MOVE AT 0100-09.  OUTBOUND CREW AT ALLENTOWN MET 166'S CREW AT LEHIGHTON.  THE 51ST CAR, CP 520931 WHICH WAS NOT DERAILED, REMAINED AT THE SITE FORSTABILITY FOR THE DERAILED CARS.  THE REMAINING 18 CARS (ALL DOCKSIDE) WERE PULLED BACK TO TAYLOR BY YARD ASSIGNMENT D13.  TRAIN 2412-09 WAS ADDED AND MARKED FOR 0500-09 EX BING WITH A POOL CREW WHOWAS TAXIED TO TAYLOR AND RAN WITH THE 18 DOCKSIDES WITH CP POWER CP 5721 AND CP 5592.  ARRANGMENTS WERE MADE WITH NS THAT TRAIN WILL BE HANDED OFF AT HARRISBURG WHERE THE NS WILL MOVE THE 18 DOCKSIDETO ALLENTOWN.  CAUSE:  BROKEN RAIL ON READING AND NORTHERN RAILROAD DUE TO LACK OF PROPER MAINTENANCE AND FAILURE TO HAVE SPERRY TEST FOR INTERNAL DEFECTS.  CONTACTED READING AND BLUE MOUNTAIN
185061-d-04-08-04-DH.Maintenance Parent Railroad Company Name: READING BLUE MOUNTAIN & NORTHERN RAILROAD COMMISSION

185084-d-04-11-04-DH.Primary Accident Cause: Lateral drawbar force on curve excessive, train make-up
185084-d-04-11-04-DH.Accident Cause: Lateral drawbar force on curve excessive, train make-up
185084-d-04-11-04-DH.Narrative: TRAIN 413-11 PROCEEDING NORTH THE IN 8TH NOTCH AT 19 MPH, FELT A SURGE AND TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND 15 CARS DERAILED. METHOD OF OPERATION SHOWN AS "OTHER" - DCS RULES. DCS TERRITORY (AUTHORIZED BY FORM D).  FINAL CAUSE PENDING A TRAIN SIMULATION.  UPDATE ON CAUSE:THIS DERAILMENT WAS PRIMARILY CAUSED BY A BLOCK OF POORLY STEERING EMPTY CARS, WITH HIGH TRAILING TONNAGE, EACH GENERATING AVERAGE AND PEAK LOW RAIL TRUCK SIDE L/V RATIOS IN EXCESS OF THE LIMITING THRESHOLD FOR LOW RAIL ROLL OVER.  IN THIS LOAD ENVIRONMENT, GAUGE PERTURBATIONS IN THE VICINITY OF THE SUSPECTED POD BECAME A STRONG SECONDARY CONTRIBUTING FACTOR.  THIS OFFICE RECOMMENDS FRA CAUSE CODE H506 (LATERAL DRAWBAR FORCE ON CURVE EXCESSIVE, TRAIN MAKE-UP) BE ASSIGNED AS THE PRIMARY CAUSE CODE OF THE ACCIDENT.  THIRD PARTY CAUSE, (NS), 9/15/04, "YES THE NS ACCEPTED RESPONSIBILITY, PER MGROPERATIONS, D&H RAILWAY."

0401-d-04-23-04-MCER.Primary Accident Cause: Other brake defects, cars (Provide detailed description in  narrative)
0401-d-04-23-04-MCER.Accident Cause: Other brake defects, cars (Provide detailed description in  narrative)
0401-d-04-23-04-MCER.Narrative:
THE SLACK ADJUSTER ON BAR 5931 WAS INOPERATIVE.  THE SLACK ADJUSTER CONTROL ROD WAS OUT OT THE HOLDER AND THE STOP DEVICE BROKEN OFF.  THIS CAR WAS BEING SWITCHED TO OUR CUSTOMER ON THE CUSTOMER LEADWITH THE HAND BRAKE APPLIED WHEN THE CAR STARTED ROLLING DOWN A 1% GRADE TOWARDS A PUBLIC GRADE CROSSING AND  THE CUSTOMERS PLANT.  THE CONDUCTOR GOT ON THE CAR AND TRIED TO TIGHTEN THE HAND BRAKE WITH NO SUCCESS.  THE CAR CONTINUED TO ROLL TOWARDS OUR CUSTOMERS BUILDING AND ROLLED THROUGH THEIR RAIL HEAD DOOR COMING TO REST AGAINST BUMPER.  THE CAR DESTROYED THE BUMPER, RAIL DOCK WALLS, AND BENTAND TWISTED 3 SUPPORTS IN THE BUILDING.

THE MECHANICAL DEFECTS OF THE BOXCAR ARE AS FOLLOWS:
A-BEND DRAW HEADS BROKEN AND INOPERATIVE, CUSHION DEVICE BROKE OFF CAR, DOORS RIGHT-LEFT SIDE INOPERATIVE, "PLUG DOORS" BROKE OFF TRAIN, B-END BULK HEAD BOWED AND BEAT OUTWARD, HAND BRAKE AND ALL SAFETYAPPLIANCES DESTOYED, B-END FLOOR PANELS AND FLOOR SUPPORTS BROKE-MISSING, BEND CENTER STILL BENT AND BROKEN, B-END MAIN TRAIN LINE BROKE AND CRACKED, A-B BRAKE RIGGING BROKE AND INOPERATIVE, AND SLACK ADJUSTER BROKE AND INOPERATIVE.

THE EQUIPMENT, TRACK, AND STRUCTURE DOLLAR AMOUNT DAMAGES ARE ESTIMATED

TYPE OF ACCIDENT - RUNAWAY BOXCAR, DERAIL

PRIMARY CAUSE - BRAKE INOPERATIVE SLACK ADJUSTER

184957-d-04-01-04-SOO.Narrative: CUT OF RUNAWAY RAILCARS (18 LOADS, 7 EMPTIES, 2,583 TONS, 1,343 FEET) ON SINGLE MAIN TRACK IMPACTEDES WELDING TRUCK, RESULTING IN EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO WELDING TRUCK, NO DERAILMENT.  NO INJURIES REPORTED.  FOR COMPLETE DESCRIPTION AND INVESTIGATION RESULTS REFER TO ATTACHED DOCUMENTATION.    BRIEF DESCRIPTION:  25 CARS ROLLED OUT OF R-2 THROUGH THE DUPONT XO ONTO THE MAIN TRACK WHERE THEY COLLIDEDWITH AN ES WELDING TRUCK. THIS INCIDENT WAS INVESTIGATED BY ALL THREE FUNCTIONS. INITIAL TRAIN INSPECTION BY MS FOUND NO AIR ON THE 25 CARS AND 7 HANDBRAKES APPLIED. ES FORCES VERIFIED THAT THEY HAD APPLIED THE 7 HANDBRAKES TO THE CARS IN ORDER TO BRING TO A STOP. THE FOUR HANDBRAKES PREVIOUSLY APPLIED BY THE SWITCH CREW WERE COMPLETELY RELEASED WHEN ENCOUNTERED BY ES.      IN SIMULATIONS IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CARS WOULD NOT REMAIN STATIONARY ON R-2 WITHOUT HAND BRAKES APPLIED. MOVEMENT WASIMMEDIATE. THE CONCLUSION IS THAT HANDBRAKES WERE PREVIOUSLY APPLIED TO THE 25 CARS.     THREE DAYSLATER A FIRE WAS SET IN A GONDOLA AT HUMBOLDT YARD. TWO DAYS AFTER THAT ES MAINTENANCE EQUIPMENT WAS VANDALIZED WITH BROKEN WINDOWS AND FIRE EXTINGUISHERS USED.     VANDALISM IS NOT A POPULAR CAUSE CODE. ONE - IT IS HARD TO PROVE VERSE CREW ERROR AND SECOND, IT IS HARD TO PROTECT AGAINST DUE TO ITSRANDOMNESS. HOWEVER, THE CREW INSISTED THEY HAD SECURED THE EQUIPMENT AND SUBSEQUENT SIMULATIONS DETERMINING THE CARS WILL NOT STAND WITHOUT SECUREMENT APPEARS TO VERIFY THEIR STATEMENTS. THE ADDIT

185392-d-04-29-04-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Human Factor - motive power and equipment
185392-d-04-29-04-SOO.Accident Cause: Human Factor - motive power and equipment
185392-d-04-29-04-SOO.Narrative: UNITS (CP 8504/8546)  OFF 293'S CONSIST AND UNITS CP 9300/9675 OFF 736'S CONSIST WERE BEING MANNED AND SHOVED FROM SOUTH SERVICE ISLAND TRACK EASTWARD TO THE SOUTH FORNOW TRACK (APPROXIMATELY 500 FEET) BY MECHANICAL SERVICES EMPLOYEES.  INSIDE HOSTLER WAS OPERATING THE MOVE FROM CP 9300, THIRD UNITIN THE FOUR-UNIT CONSIST.  ROUNDHOUSE LABORER WALKED EAST AND TURNED ON THE BUZZER AND TOOK OFF THEDERAIL AND VIA RADIO DIRECTED THE MOVEMENT TO PROCEED EASTWARD.  ROUNDHOUSE LABORER BOARDED EAST UNIT AND RODE THE CONSIST INTO THE SOUTH FORNOW TRACK.  AS THE MOVEMENT APPROACHED THE EAST END OF THESOUTH FORNOW TRACK, ROUNDHOUSE LABORER GAVE CAR SIGNS VIA RADIO TO STOP.  WHEN THE HOSTLER BEGAN TOSTOP THE MOVEMENT THE TWO EAST UNITS OF THE CONSIST SEPARATED AND CONTINUED MOVING EASTWARD.  ROUNDHOUSE LABORER ATTEMPTED TO STOP THE UNITS BY APPLYING HANDBRAKE ON CP 8504.  AS MOVEMENT CONTINUED TOWARD 21 POCKET,  RH LABORER NOTED THE SWITCHES WERE LINED OFF THE SOUTH FORNOW TRACK TOWARD 21 POCKET AND THAT AN ENGINE WITH CARS WERE PULLING OUT OF THE BOWL OFF THE HUMP HEADING ACROSS HIS PATH TOWARD THE NEW WESTBOUND.  RH LABORER WAS UNSUCCESSFUL IN STOPPING THE TWO UNITS AND MADE CONTACT WITHFORD HAULER TRAIN AT THE EAST END OF THE 21 POCKET STRIKING EMPTY AUTO RACK NS 110219.  IMPACT RESULTED IN DAMAGE TO THE PLOW, STEPS AND HANDRAILS OF CP 8504 AND SCRAPING DAMAGE TO THE FULL LENGTH OFTHE NORTH SIDE OF NS 110219.  NO DERAILMENT OCCURRED AND NO INJURIES REPORTED.
